newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares close higher at end of settlement.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares close higher at end of settlement.

text.p: Delhi shares closed higher as speculators made selective purchases amid some short covering, at the end of settlement, brokers said.
The Delhi bourse's sensitive benchmark index ended 2.09 points higher at 694.48.
"The market has started showing a gradual recovery although it was confined to a few counters," said Rajeev Arora of brokers Vashisht Financial Services.
Reliance Industries ended 0.50 rupee higher at 186 while TISCO dropped 0.30 rupee to 167.70.
State Bank of India rose 6.30 rupees to 219.60 and Larsen and Toubro quoted 2.50 rupees higher at 221.25.
ITC firmed up 3.45 rupees at 256.05 while Hindustan Lever gained one rupee at 775.
TELCO ended six rupees higher at 405.
On Sunday, there will a special trading session on the Delhi bourse from 6.00 p.m. to 8.00 p.m. on account of Hindu festival of Diwali.
The Delhi bourse will remain closed on Monday and Tuesday on account of Hindu festivals.
